benchmark_details.name: STEER-ME
benchmark_details.overview: STEER-ME is a benchmark for assessing the microeconomic reasoning of large language models, focusing on non-strategic economic tasks such as supply and demand analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the economic reasoning ability of large language models in non-strategic settings across a variety of microeconomic problems.

data.source: Created using a novel LLM-assisted data generation protocol called auto-STEER, which adapts handwritten templates into multiple economic contexts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated as averages over all questions in each element.
methodology.interpretation: An LLM's score on an element reflects its performance on questions that assess economic reasoning.
methodology.validation: A total of 27 LLMs were evaluated using different metrics across various economic tasks.
